content.div:
You heard the song, then you heard the 13-minute version of the song. Maybe you even bought the commemorative shoes! And now -- as of this morning, anyway -- you can watch the video for Gorillaz, James Murphy and Andre 3000's Converse "Three Artists, One Song" collab, "DoYaThing." The clip, which blends live action footage with 3-D and 2-D animation, debuted via Converse's website -- but that's it posted below.

The video, directed by the cartoon band's co-creator, Jamie Hewlett, depicts a sleepy morning in the Gorillaz household of 212 Wobble Street -- one, perhaps, not unlike one of your own, minus the bit where you breakfast on severed ears and toast.

As we reported previously, "DoYaThing" is being offered as a free download via Converse.com, where you can also purchase Chuck Taylor All Stars that have been styled in the Gorillaz fashion. Fast forward to 3:58 in the video for suggested uses of said sneaks. (Particularly recommended for anyone suffering roommate troubles.)

Watch "DoYaThing" below:

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: A new Drake song, "The Real Her" featuring Lil Wayne, surfaced today. It's thought to be an unofficial leak off the Toronto rapper's upcoming album Take Care.

link.Abstract: Hey, ladies -- particularly those of you with nail polish and fragrance lines -- Drake has a message for you: "Make Me Proud."
link.title: Listen: Drake Debuts 'Make Me Proud'

link.Abstract: Drake debuted his video for "Headlines." Watch it here.
link.title: Drake Debuts 'Headlines,' Opens Rogers Centre Dome, Wears Lots of Sweaters

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber appears to have recorded his own PG version of Drake's "Trust Issues." Hear it here.
link.title: Justin Bieber Cleans Up Drake's 'Trust Issues' (Except For the Bit About Purple Drank, Because Kids Need Cough Syrup Sometimes)

entry.title: Photos: 2012 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: If you want photos of Adele looking adorable, you've come to the right place. The 2012 BRIT Awards went down in London Feb. 21. The show airs in Canada on MuchMusic, Feb. 21 at 8 p.m. Check out some of the highlights, with these pics of Rihanna, Coldplay, Kylie Minogue, Florence and the Machine and more.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech. The biggest pop star in the world -- we repeat, the biggest pop star in the world -- was interrupted while accepting the BRIT Award for album of the year.
Adele: "You're going to cut me off?"
Host, James Corden: "I'm so sorry."
Adele: "Can I just say, then, goodbye and I'll see you next time 'round, yeah?" (Flips her middle finger.)
link.title: Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech.

link.Abstract: The stars are across the pond celebrated music's big night at the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, 2012. Check out the fashion winners and losers, and vote for your favourite looks!
link.title: Rate the Fashion: The 2012 Brit Awards

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine are set to play the 2012 BRIT Awards, but we've got pics of nominee Florence Welch shaking it out before the show. Watch the BRITs on MuchMusic, Feb. 21 at 8 p.m. ET.
link.title: Photos: Florence + The Machine Rehearse for The BRITs

entry.content: If you want photos of Adele looking adorable, you've come to the right place. The 2012 BRIT Awards went down in London Feb. 21. The show airs in Canada on MuchMusic, Feb. 21 at 8 p.m. Check out some of the highlights, with these pics of Rihanna, Coldplay, Kylie Minogue, Florence and the Machine and more.
